p: WNV neurovirulence and neuroinvasion are typically associated with sequence variations in the flavivirus E protein [ 124]; strikingly, a unique mutation at position 249 in the helicase portion of NS3 (NS3249P) has been identified in virus strains that have been responsible for major WNV outbreaks during the two last decades [ 125] and its role in the modulation of WNV virulence and transmission is nowadays largely debated [ 126, 127].
